column4: the MAUSB-10 is supposedly supported, ubuntu even has a driver for it, but heck if i can find anything. even my hp built in card reader works with 10.04, sorry man.
correct it is supposed to be supported by ALAUDA, but it hs never worked under any *nix--it does work under WIN XP, so I know the reader is working

did you see this post? <ActionParsnip> hylian: boto without the device attatched, then log in and get teh system settled. Then plug in the reader, wait 10 seconds and then run: dmesg | tail -n 20    please use http://pastie.org to give output
yes I did-will do so in a few
